Class ReversiController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ReversiController

  • public class ReversiController
extends java.lang.Object
    ReversiController is the controller for Reversi
    Author:
    DennyHo and Ryan Luu

    • Method Detail

      • humanTurn

        public void humanTurn(int row,
                      int col,
                      int color)
               throws ReversiIllegalLocationException
        Human turn places token and captures any opponent pieces.
        Parameters:
        row - : intended row for placement
        col - : intended column for placement
        Throws:
        ReversiIllegalLocationException

      • computerTurn

        public void computerTurn(int color)
        Computer turn finds a legal space that will result in the most captures and places its token at that location. If best location ties in value, the first location is chosen.
        Parameters:
        color: - parameter used to determine which color is played by the Bot

      • getGrid

        public int[][] getGrid()
        Gets the grid in a string representation
        Returns:
        the grid

      • updateValidMoves

        public void updateValidMoves(int color)
        Updates the model's number of valid moves for current player
        Parameters:
        color - : color of the player whose number of valid moves will be updated

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove(int row,
                           int col,
                           int color)
        Checks if location is a legal move
        Parameters:
        row - : row of move
        col - : column of move
        color - : color of token to be placed
        Returns:
        whether location is legal

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Checks if game has ended. Game ends when board is full or no more legal moves are left for both players.
        Returns:
        whether game has ended

      • updateScore

        public void updateScore()
        Update the score inside the model. Counts number of Black token and White tokens on the board to get score.
